Two apples, one handwash: Pakistan's strangest theft case from judge's chamber
description: Police in Pakistan's Punjab province have registered a theft case over two apples and a hand wash bottle stolen from a sessions court judge's chamber in Lahore. The FIR was filed based on the judge's instructions, with the stolen items valued at Rs 1,000. The case is being investigated under Section 380 of the Pakistan Penal Code.

description: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has summoned IndiGo's CEO for an emergency meeting. This follows days of mass flight cancellations and passenger complaints. The regulator is conducting on-site assessments at airports. IndiGo leadership must account for its handling of the disruption. The airline has cancelled thousands of flights nationwide.

title: Kritika Kamra makes relationship with Gaurav Kapur Insta-official: ‘Breakfast with…’

description: IndiGo faces potential competition law investigation following thousands of flight cancellations due to crew shortages. India's competition watchdog is considering probing the airline for misusing its dominant market position.

title: Exclusive | 'It's loyalty': Rovman Powell on why Caribbean stars stick to their IPL franchises
description: Rovman Powell reflects on how franchise leagues transformed his life -- from financial security to building lifelong friendships. The West Indies power-hitter opens up about his journey from Bannister, discovering his talent early, and the discipline that shaped his career. Powell discusses natural Caribbean power, ILT20’s impact on UAE cricket, the Caribbean loyalty seen in IPL stars, and why six sixes in an over will soon be more common.

description: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor declined the Veer Savarkar Award, calling organizers irresponsible for announcing his name without consent. He learned of the award through media reports and stated he neither knew about nor accepted it. HRDS India, however, claims they notified Tharoor and visited him to extend the invitation.

Sudha Murty calls for teaching Vande Mataram in schools: How it benefits students
description: Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murty urged making Vande Mataram compulsory in schools, highlighting its role in instilling courage, sacrifice, and a sense of belonging among students. Marking the song’s 150th anniversary, she emphasized its historical significance during India’s freedom struggle and noted that teaching national songs fosters values, civic consciousness, memory retention, and a lasting connection to the country’s cultural and moral heritage.

description: Hardik Pandya attributes his strong comeback from injury to a positive mindset, enabling him to return "stronger, bigger and better." His impressive performance in the T20I against South Africa, featuring an unbeaten 59 and a wicket, showcased his full recovery. Pandya emphasized relying on inner confidence and enjoying the game, drawing energy from the crowd as a key motivator.

title: England is suffering from ‘Psychological phenomenon known as the Dunning-Kruger effect,’ says Greg Chappell and calls Bazball a dubbed reckless approach

description: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has become a box office sensation, garnering positive reviews and impressive collections. The film demonstrated strong weekday stability, maintaining collections in the Rs. 20 crore range and is now eyeing Rs 200 crore by the end of its first week, with potential to enter the Rs 500 crore club.

description: SpiceJet is significantly boosting its winter operations, adding up to 100 daily flights to meet surging demand amid IndiGo's widespread cancellations. This expansion, supported by reactivated aircraft, aims to capitalize on market gaps. IndiGo's pilot shortage led to over 5,000 flight cancellations and a government-mandated schedule reduction, creating an opportunity for competitors and potentially rebalancing market share.

description: The Delhi high court questioned the Centre's failure to prevent IndiGo's flight cancellations and soaring airfares, demanding to know immediate measures taken for stranded passengers. The court also sought explanations on arrangements made to manage travellers and prevent harassment, as hundreds of flights were scrapped, leaving lakhs stranded nationwide.

Authorities are investigating the expired licenses and the local body's failure to act. Efforts are underway to apprehend the fugitives.

20 stitches! Cricket coach assaulted with bat over team selection; FIR lodged
description: Pondicherry U-19 coach S Venkataraman was severely assaulted by three local cricketers at the CAP training facility after being dropped from the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy squad. The attack, which left Venkataraman with a head injury and shoulder fracture, has led to an FIR and an ongoing police investigation against the assailants.

title: ‘Release goats worth Rs 1 crore into forests’: Maharashtra minister Ganesh Naik’s plan to curb leopard attacks
H1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
description: US Embassy India has issued a crucial advisory for visa applicants, warning that attending a previously scheduled appointment after receiving a rescheduling notice will lead to denied entry. This comes as H-1B visa interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules, potentially delaying foreign workers' return to the US for months.

Diwali makes it to Unesco list; joins Yoga, Durga Puja among intangible cultural heritage
description: Deepavali has been inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage list, marking the 16th Indian tradition to receive this honor. This recognition occurred during the 20th session of the Intergovernmental Committee for the Safeguarding of Intangible Cultural Heritage, hosted by India in New Delhi. The committee is reviewing 67 nominations from 79 countries.

title: Deepavali festival on Unesco Representative List of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity 2025: Here’s the full list
CBSE issues new rules for class 10 science, social science boards: What students must follow
description: CBSE has introduced new rules for Class 10 Science and Social Science exams. Students must now write answers only in their designated sections. Examiners will not award marks for answers placed in the wrong section, even if correct. Schools are urged to practice this format. This change aims to prevent confusion and mark loss during evaluations.

title: Human Rights Day: 10 timely interventions by Supreme Court, high courts against violations
Chinese woman uses her scarf to clean up spilled bubble tea in metro — watch
description: A thoughtful woman in China has earned widespread praise after using her own scarf to clean up spilled bubble tea on a subway. The heartwarming incident, captured on video, quickly went viral, highlighting her respect for public spaces.  In recognition of her considerate act, the subway company reportedly gifted her a new scarf and other presents.

Veggie 'burgers' under fire: Why is Europe planning to ban names of plant-based foods?
description: EU countries and lawmakers are set for contentious negotiations over a proposal to ban plant-based foods from using traditional meat labels like "sausage" and "burger." Backed by the European Parliament to protect farmers, the measure aims to reserve meat terminology for animal products, sparking debate over consumer transparency and the plant-based sector's future.

title: Consequences companies could face under Right to Disconnect Bill
description: The Right to Disconnect Bill outlines clear consequences for companies that continue to demand after-hours availability, proposing financial penalties, mandatory transparency, and enforceable communication norms. While not yet enacted, the proposal signals a decisive shift in how India expects employers to respect personal time. If adopted, it could redefine accountability in an era where digital overreach has become routine.

description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee publicly tore up new MGNREGA norms, accusing the Centre of imposing 'valueless' conditions and withholding funds. She highlighted her state's Karmashree scheme as an alternative, vowing to increase workdays and asserting Bengal's fight for dignity and federal rights amidst upcoming elections.

Gave fake name, ID: Watch how cops arrested Luigi Mangione for CEO murder
description: Newly released bodycam footage captures the moment murder suspect Luigi Mangione was apprehended at a Pennsylvania McDonald's, a year after his initial arrest. Alerted by customers recognizing his distinctive eyebrows, police confronted Mangione, who initially provided a false name.

title: Cardiac services halted at Jammu Super Speciality Hospital, High Court takes note
Rename Veer Bal Diwas to Sahibzade Shahadat Diwas: Punjab MP to Modi
107 oppn MPs submit notice to remove Madras HC judge over lamp-lighting order
description: Over 100 opposition MPs have submitted a notice to the Lok Sabha Speaker seeking the removal of Madras High Court Justice GR Swaminathan. They accuse him of misconduct and bias in a recent order concerning a lamp lighting at a temple near a dargah in Tamil Nadu.

title: Andrew Tate gives opinion on Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua ahead of Dubai debut
description: Andrew Tate shared his thoughts on the upcoming Jake Paul vs. Anthony Joshua fight, calling it "interesting" just days before his own boxing debut. Tate expressed respect for anyone entering the ring and hoped both Paul and Joshua would emerge safely. He also addressed weight clause controversies surrounding his own fight, stating he accepted all conditions.

title: ‘Model neighbours’ to 'fugitives': Upscale Delhi colony in shock over 'missing' Luthra brothers
description: The family home of Goa nightclub owners Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, implicated in a fatal fire, stands deserted in Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar. Neighbours recall the family as religious and good-natured, expressing shock at their alleged flight to Phuket. The brothers' business journey from local boutiques to successful cafes is also detailed.

title: Gujarat teen chops friend into pieces over affairs
description: Jealousy over a shared love interest led to a brutal murder in Kutch. A 19-year-old allegedly killed his friend, dismembered the body, and buried the parts across the district. The crime surfaced after the victim's brother filed a missing person report, triggering an investigation that revealed a complex love triangle and a desperate attempt to conceal the horrific act.

title: 'Don’t want a woman who marries her brother...': Trump slams Ilhan Omar
PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
description: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

title: Marvin Harrison Jr. injury update: Heel issue puts Cardinals WR’s week 15 return in doubt
description: Marvin Harrison Jr.'s rookie season faces another hurdle with a heel issue, sidelining him for Week 14 and making his Week 15 availability uncertain.  With the Cardinals out of playoff contention, they are unlikely to rush him back. Michael Wilson has stepped up significantly in Harrison's absence, capitalizing on increased opportunities and becoming a key offensive contributor.

title: 'Not gonna lie': Naomi Osaka rejects proposal, opens up on tough days as mom
description: Naomi Osaka opened up about motherhood's challenges and rejected a fan's marriage proposal during an Instagram Q&A. Despite an injury-shortened 2025 season ending at the Japan Open, she expressed pride in her resilience and gratitude for her health and daughter, Shai. Osaka is slated to begin her 2026 season at the ASB Classic.
